parameters.content:
## Form Intake Trigger
**Form intake** is the trigger form by n8n that asks for initial data and works on top of that.

messageValues.message:
=Summarize the following article based on the research subject: “{{ $('Form intake').item.json['Subject for Research'] }}”.

Keep it under 120 words. 
Return JSON exactly like this without any "output" field:
{
  "title": "",
  "summary": "",
  "keywords": []
}

=From this summary, extract the single biggest painful problem enterprise customers face.  

Return JSON: {   "pain": "",   "severity": 1-10,   "why_it_matters": "" }

parameters.content:
## RSS Read, Sort, and 10 items 
**RSS Read** node gathers the RSS feed from the link provided. It gets all the feed, we then need to sort out what we actually need.

**Sort** node sorts the RSS feed based on the most recent feeds. 

**Code node** node is written with code that just outputs 10 items per feed.

## Merge & Loopback Period
**Merge** node merges all the 10-10-10 results from each feed and makes them 100 news articles.

**Loopback Period** node sorts the RSS feed based on the loopback period that will be mentioned in the forms.

## 10 items & Loop
**10 items** node takes only 10 items from all the provided results. These will be based from the previous node where every item will again be sorted based on most recent feed.

**Loop** node iterates over every article into getting more information from them

values.placeholder: how many days back to search

values.fieldLabel: Topic on which the post should be

parameters.content:
## HTML full article & Get Data from HTML
**HTML full article** node gets the whole HTML page of the article link provided from the rss feed. It contains all html tags and stuff.

**Get Data from HTML** node cleans all the HTML tags and all other notations and gives out clear and refined data

## Summary Generator & Painful Issue Generator
**Summary Generator** node gives all the clean data extracted from the link and generates a title, summary and some keywords.

**Painful Issue Generator** node understand the summary and identifies the painful issues based on the subject and messaging context. It generates the pain point, it's severity and why it matters.

messageValues.message:
=Using:
- All extracted pains
- All summaries + keywords
- Subject: “{{ $('Form intake').item.json['Subject for Research'] }}”
- Messaging theme: “{{ $('Form intake').item.json['Topic on which the post should be'] }}”

Create a LinkedIn carousel concept with:
1. conceptTitle
2. 5 slideOutlines (1 sentence each)
3. icp { title, industry, painPoint }
4. 3 hooks
5. a CTA

Please note that the hook line should grab the attention of the reader instantly to make them read the complete post.
Also the slide Outline should be engaging and trigger curiosity in every aspect and answer their all doubts.
The call to action shouldn't feel like a call to action but it should sub-consiously make them do the action.
The concept title is the main thing that everyone reads, so give most of your efforts there itself.

Return JSON only.

parameters.content:
## Aggregate, LinkedIn Post Generator & JSON Parser
**Aggregate** node combines all the 10 results of summaries and pain points generated in the loop into 1 single list.

**LinkedIn Post Generator** node uses OpenAI and generates all the content required to generate a linked in post, like title, slide outline, hooks, cta, etc.

**JSON Parser** node helps in seperating all the context into it's individual components.

## Image Generation
**Free Image Generator**.

This workflow uses free image generation which doesn't provide best image generation, we must replace this with a proper image generation tool. This is used just for demo purposes.

## LinkedIn Posting & Logging
**LinkedIn Post** node uses LinkedIn API to publish the post autonomously.

**Logging** node logs every post generated and published for future reference. This is done as per mentioned for publication grade system.
